text: Hello everyone. Is there a way to define a shortcut in the design manager? The goal is to define something (shortcut or character combination) to generate easily this part of code used very often: `{%-  -%}`.

You can create a document with all your definitions with {% set name == 'definition' %}.

You can then {% import 'root/global/site-settings.html' as *settings* %} in a new document/stylesheet and call your functions with {{ settings.name }}

Yes, that's what I'm doing. My question is to find a trick to not click on 9 keys to write this `{%-  -%}`. I just want to enter two characters or by a keybord combination (like `ctrl+s` for example) to write this `{%-  -%}`. I think it's possible, because when you click on `ctrl+f` when your cursor is in a window of the design manager (no drag and drop), the search tool appear at the top of the window. I want to know if we can custom shortcuts by ourselves.
For example, for a macro with 23 `{%-  -%}` instructions, I press keys 207 times. I want to reduce this to 46 (23 times `ctrl` and `x` keys).
<@U7SL518D6>, I've changed icon for my module. svg format, 1,4ko. When the icon is refreshed? I just see blank/nothing instead of the icon. The preview of the icon in the files manager is visible.
There might exist a chrome extension for this. Where you'd be able to set different keyboard macros applied for different URLs.
If you have a mac, I use a combo of snippetlab and textexpander. Textexpander is essential in my life

<https://www.renfei.org/snippets-lab/>
<https://textexpander.com/>
another potential option depending on how you prefer to work is to work locally using either FTP or the new local dev beta. That way you can use VS Code or any other preferred code editor
Even locally, I use the above tools
Textexpander has become second nature for me. Don't have to write out email addresses anymore, you can place the cursor wherever you want it. It is pretty amazing
<@U7SL518D6> I cannot upload files on FTP. I gave it up for now after reading many comments from people who have encountered the same issue.
<@UD53A9UUR> Your solution seems very interesting. There is similar tool under linux : <https://github.com/leehblue/texpander> Thank you...
Awesome. Hope it works for you

<@UM4EYDDAS> check out the new CMS CLI for local development: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development>

Should work much smoother for you and supports uploading new files.

Could update <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubL-Language-Extension> to have something for your snippet as well
Thanks <@U6W3H6YN8> . I will see it.
<@U6W3H6YN8> Do you know if I can use `hubl_snippets_gen.py` with pycharm?

I have never used pycharm but I would imagine you can. Its written in python 3.6.5. You could add a man_gen snippet for those brackets if you want though or add to the auto closing pairs to include the - as well <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubL-Language-Extension/blob/master/langconfig/language-configuration.json>

<@U6W3H6YN8> the CMS CLI seems working. I just have an error: `[ERROR] Deleting file "[path_of_the_file_I_modified_and_saved]___jb_tmp___" failed` and `[ERROR] The delete failed because "[path_of_the_file_I_modified_and_saved]___jb_tmp___" was not found in portal XXXXXXXX. resource not found`. It happened for all files (I tried with html and css files). But I see modifications if I refresh the page in design manager. It works better than local-hubl-server... And I can use my favorite IDE. Great. Thanks a lot.
Thanks for the feedback, <@UM4EYDDAS>! To confirm, you are getting those errors why trying to use the `remove` command?

This happened when I have launched this command:  `npx hscms watch --mode=draft local remote`.  Then I have modified a file, saved it, and those messages appeared, then I had `Uploaded file "[local_path_of_the_file_I_modified_and_saved]l" to "[remote_path_of_the_file_I_modified_and_saved]"`.
Thank you, what action did you take specifically that prompted the "Deleting" message?
Was it while you were in a `watch` session?
Yes. When I saved my file (ctrl+s).
Interesting. Are you using a PC?
Yes. PC under linux (Debian buster).
Is anyone having problems where this stupid design manager continues to fail on autosave?

I felt like it was happening last night but I was moving quickly, and now all day today i'm having problems. I don't have super admin in this portal so I don't have an api key. I feel like i'm gonna throw this laptop
can I disable autosave?
can you provide a bit more info on how it is failing?
I stop typing for 3 seconds and it says save failed
are there errors in the javascript console or network errors?
no
It will say saving..
and it will hang there
and then eventually it will say failed to save
it greys outs the publish changes
so then I have to liek remove a line or type a comment or do something stupid
if it didn't grey out the publish button I think this would be fine
same that was happening earlier
Greg logged into my portal and did some testing, they will start working on it in the morning
I assume it is only happening to people doing amazing coding
lol
<@U25PYL3Q8> I’ve been looking into the above issue for a long time today and I believe it is fixed now
